storyTitle: As Employee, I want to perform task status updates to achieve accurate progress tracking

testCases.title: Validate successful status update with valid input
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials
User has employee role with task update permissions
At least one task is assigned to the logged-in employee
Task has a current status that allows valid transitions
System is accessible via desktop browser
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the task detail page by clicking on an assigned task from the task list
steps.expectedResult: Task detail page loads successfully displaying task name, description, current status, and status update dropdown. Current status is clearly visible and highlighted.

steps.action: Click on the status dropdown menu to view available status options
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands showing all valid status options for the current task state. Invalid status transitions are either not displayed or are disabled/grayed out.

steps.action: Select a valid new status from the dropdown menu (e.g., change from 'In Progress' to 'Completed')
steps.expectedResult: Selected status is highlighted in the dropdown. The dropdown closes and the new status value is displayed in the status field. Submit button becomes enabled if previously disabled.

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Update Status' button to save the status change
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a success confirmation message (e.g., 'Status updated successfully'). The update completes within 2 seconds. The new status is reflected in the task detail view.

steps.action: Navigate back to the task list view
steps.expectedResult: Task list displays the updated status for the modified task, confirming the change has been persisted in the system.

postconditions: Task status is updated in the TaskStatus table
Status change is recorded with timestamp in the database
Task list reflects the new status
User remains on the task detail page or is redirected to task list
No error messages are displayed

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid status transition
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials
User has employee role with task update permissions
At least one task is assigned to the logged-in employee
Task has a current status with defined invalid transition rules (e.g., cannot move from 'Completed' to 'Not Started')
System is accessible via desktop browser
Business rules for status transitions are configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the task detail page by selecting a task with a status that has restricted transitions
steps.expectedResult: Task detail page loads successfully displaying task details and current status (e.g., 'Completed'). Status dropdown is visible and accessible.

steps.action: Click on the status dropdown to view available options and attempt to select an invalid status transition (e.g., from 'Completed' to 'Not Started')
steps.expectedResult: Invalid status options are either not displayed in the dropdown, or are displayed but disabled/grayed out with a visual indicator. If selectable, a validation warning appears immediately upon selection.

steps.action: If the invalid status was selectable, click the 'Submit' or 'Update Status' button
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the submission and displays a clear error message such as 'Invalid status transition: Cannot change from Completed to Not Started' or 'This status change is not allowed'. The original status remains unchanged.

steps.action: Verify that the task status has not changed by checking the current status display
steps.expectedResult: Task detail page continues to show the original status. No success confirmation message is displayed. The status field reverts to the original value if it was temporarily changed.

steps.action: Navigate to the task list and verify the task status
steps.expectedResult: Task list shows the original status for the task, confirming no unauthorized status change occurred.

postconditions: Task status remains unchanged in the database
Error message is displayed to the user
No status change is recorded in the audit log
User remains on the task detail page
System maintains data integrity

testCases.title: Ensure status update works on mobile devices
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid OAuth2 credentials on mobile device
User has employee role with task update permissions
At least one task is assigned to the logged-in employee
Mobile device (iOS or Android) with supported browser or native app
Mobile device has stable internet connection
Task has a current status that allows valid transitions

steps.action: Open the task management application on a mobile device (smartphone or tablet) and navigate to the task list
steps.expectedResult: Application loads with responsive mobile interface. Task list is displayed in a mobile-optimized layout with touch-friendly elements. All tasks are visible and scrollable.

steps.action: Tap on a task to access the task update interface
steps.expectedResult: Task detail page opens with mobile-responsive design. All elements (task name, description, status dropdown, submit button) are properly sized and accessible. Interface adapts to screen orientation (portrait/landscape).

steps.action: Tap on the status dropdown to view available status options
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown menu expands with touch-optimized selection options. Status options are clearly readable and have adequate touch target size (minimum 44x44 pixels). Valid status options are displayed.

steps.action: Select a valid new status from the dropdown by tapping on it
steps.expectedResult: Selected status is highlighted and the dropdown closes. New status value is displayed in the status field. No UI elements overlap or become inaccessible.

steps.action: Tap the 'Submit' or 'Update Status' button to save the change
steps.expectedResult: System processes the update within 2 seconds. Success confirmation message appears in a mobile-friendly format (toast notification or modal). The message is clearly visible and does not obstruct other UI elements.

steps.action: Navigate back to the task list view by using the back button or navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Task list reloads and displays the updated status for the modified task. The status change is immediately visible in the mobile task list view.

steps.action: Verify the status change persists by closing and reopening the application
steps.expectedResult: Upon reopening, the task list shows the updated status, confirming the change was successfully saved to the server and persisted.

postconditions: Task status is updated in the database
Status change is visible on both mobile and desktop platforms
Mobile interface remains responsive and functional
User can continue to perform other actions on mobile device
No layout or rendering issues occur on mobile view

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to perform editing task status updates to achieve correction of mistakes

testCases.title: Validate successful status edit within allowed time window
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid credentials and has edit permissions
User has employee role with status edit authorization
At least one task has a status update submitted less than 30 minutes ago
TaskStatusHistory table contains recent status update records
Audit trail logging is enabled and functional
System time is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Navigate to the task detail page and locate the 'Status History' or 'View History' section
steps.expectedResult: Task status history section is displayed showing a chronological list of all status updates with timestamps, previous status, new status, and user who made the change. Most recent updates appear at the top.

steps.action: Identify a status update that was submitted less than 30 minutes ago (timestamp should be within the allowed edit window)
steps.expectedResult: Recent status update is visible with a timestamp showing it is within the 30-minute window. An 'Edit' button or icon is displayed next to the status update entry, indicating it is editable.

steps.action: Click the 'Edit' button next to the recent status update
steps.expectedResult: Edit interface opens, either as a modal dialog or inline form. The current status value is pre-populated in an editable dropdown or field. A status dropdown shows all valid status options based on transition rules.

steps.action: Select a different valid status from the dropdown menu (e.g., change from 'In Progress' to 'On Hold')
steps.expectedResult: New status is selected and highlighted in the dropdown. The interface shows the change clearly, possibly with a visual indicator showing 'Original: In Progress' and 'New: On Hold'.

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Update' button to submit the edited status change
steps.expectedResult: System processes the edit within 2 seconds. A success confirmation message appears (e.g., 'Status update edited successfully'). The edit interface closes and returns to the status history view.

steps.action: Verify the status history now reflects the edited status
steps.expectedResult: Status history shows the updated status value with an indicator that it was edited (e.g., 'Edited' badge or icon). The timestamp of the original update is preserved, but an 'Edited at' timestamp is also displayed.

steps.action: Navigate to the audit trail or system logs to verify the edit was logged
steps.expectedResult: Audit trail contains a new entry recording the status edit with details including: original status, new status, user who made the edit, timestamp of edit, and task ID. All required audit information is complete and accurate.

steps.action: Check the current task status on the task detail page
steps.expectedResult: Task detail page displays the newly edited status as the current status. The change is reflected throughout the system consistently.

postconditions: Status update is modified in TaskStatusHistory table
Audit trail entry is created with complete edit details
Current task status reflects the edited value
Original timestamp is preserved with additional edit timestamp
Manager notification is queued or sent
User remains on task detail or history page

testCases.title: Verify rejection of status edit after time window
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid credentials and has edit permissions
User has employee role with status edit authorization
At least one task has a status update submitted more than 30 minutes ago
TaskStatusHistory table contains status update records older than 30 minutes
System time is synchronized and accurate
30-minute edit window validation is configured and active

steps.action: Navigate to the task detail page and access the 'Status History' section
steps.expectedResult: Task status history is displayed showing all status updates with timestamps. Status updates older than 30 minutes are visible in the list.

steps.action: Locate a status update that was submitted more than 30 minutes ago (check timestamp to confirm it is outside the edit window)
steps.expectedResult: Status update with timestamp older than 30 minutes is visible. The 'Edit' button is either not displayed, is disabled/grayed out, or shows a visual indicator that editing is not allowed (e.g., lock icon).

steps.action: Attempt to click the 'Edit' button or option for the expired status update (if visible)
steps.expectedResult: If the button is disabled, no action occurs and a tooltip may appear stating 'Edit window expired'. If the button is clickable, the system prevents the edit interface from opening or immediately shows an error message.

steps.action: If edit interface opens, attempt to modify the status and click 'Save' or 'Update'
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the submission and displays a clear error message such as 'Edit window expired - status updates can only be edited within 30 minutes of submission' or 'Cannot edit status: time limit exceeded'.

steps.action: Verify the error message is displayed prominently and provides clear guidance
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed in a visible location (modal, banner, or inline message) with appropriate styling (red color, error icon). Message clearly explains why the edit was rejected and the time constraint.

steps.action: Close the error message and return to the status history view
steps.expectedResult: Status history view is displayed without any changes. The expired status update remains in its original state.

steps.action: Verify that no changes were made to the status history by checking the status update details
steps.expectedResult: The status update older than 30 minutes shows the original status value with no modifications. No 'Edited' indicator is present. The timestamp remains unchanged.

steps.action: Check the audit trail to confirm no edit attempt was logged as successful
steps.expectedResult: Audit trail does not contain any successful edit entry for this status update. Optionally, a failed edit attempt may be logged for security purposes, but the status itself remains unchanged.

steps.action: Verify the current task status has not changed
steps.expectedResult: Task detail page shows the same status as before the edit attempt. No unauthorized changes occurred in the system.

postconditions: Status update remains unchanged in TaskStatusHistory table
No audit trail entry for successful edit is created
Error message is displayed to user
Current task status remains the same
System maintains data integrity and time-based validation
User remains on task detail or history page

testCases.title: Ensure notifications are sent to managers on status edits
preconditions: User is authenticated with valid credentials and has edit permissions
User has employee role with status edit authorization
At least one task has a status update submitted less than 30 minutes ago
Task has an assigned manager with valid notification settings
Manager notification system is configured and operational
Notification service is running and accessible
Manager has a valid email address or notification channel configured

steps.action: Navigate to the task status history and select a recent status update (less than 30 minutes old) to edit
steps.expectedResult: Status history is displayed with recent updates. Edit option is available for the selected status update within the time window.

steps.action: Click the 'Edit' button to open the edit interface
steps.expectedResult: Edit interface opens with the current status pre-populated and a dropdown showing valid status options.

steps.action: Modify the status by selecting a different valid status from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: New status is selected and displayed in the edit interface. The change is clearly visible to the user.

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update' to submit the edited status change
steps.expectedResult: System processes the edit successfully within 2 seconds. Success confirmation message appears (e.g., 'Status updated and manager notified'). The edit is saved to the database and audit trail.

steps.action: Access the manager notification system or inbox (log in as the assigned manager or check notification logs)
steps.expectedResult: Manager notification system shows a new notification related to the status edit. Notification appears in the manager's notification center, email inbox, or configured notification channel.

steps.action: Open and review the notification content
steps.expectedResult: Notification contains accurate and complete information including: task name/ID, employee who made the edit, original status, new edited status, timestamp of edit, and a link to view the task details.

steps.action: Verify the notification includes all required details: task identifier, original status, new status, employee name, and edit timestamp
steps.expectedResult: All required information is present and accurate in the notification. The notification is formatted clearly and professionally. Links (if any) are functional and direct to the correct task.

steps.action: Check the notification timestamp to ensure it was sent immediately after the edit
steps.expectedResult: Notification timestamp is within seconds of the status edit submission time, confirming real-time or near-real-time notification delivery.

steps.action: Verify in the system logs or notification service that the notification was successfully delivered
steps.expectedResult: System logs or notification service dashboard shows successful delivery status for the manager notification. No delivery errors or failures are recorded.

postconditions: Status edit is successfully saved in the database
Manager receives notification via configured channel
Notification contains accurate task and edit details
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Audit trail includes both the status edit and notification event
Manager can access task details from notification link

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to perform receiving notifications for task status updates to achieve timely awareness

testCases.title: Validate notification delivery on status update
preconditions: User is logged into the system as an employee
User has at least one task assigned to them
User has both in-app and email notifications enabled in settings
User has valid email address configured in profile
Notification service is running and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the task details page for an assigned task
steps.expectedResult: Task details page loads successfully showing current task status

steps.action: Update the task status from current status to a different status (e.g., from 'Pending' to 'In Progress')
steps.expectedResult: Status update is processed successfully and task status is changed in the system

steps.action: Click on the notifications icon in the application header to view in-app notifications
steps.expectedResult: Notification appears in the in-app notification panel with task name, new status ('In Progress'), and timestamp of the status change

steps.action: Open the email inbox associated with the user account
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received within 5 seconds containing task name, new status, timestamp, and link to the task

steps.action: Verify the content accuracy of both in-app and email notifications
steps.expectedResult: Both notifications display identical and accurate information matching the task status update

postconditions: Task status remains updated in the system
Notification is marked as delivered in the notification service logs
User can access the task from notification links

testCases.title: Verify notification preference settings
preconditions: User is logged into the system as an employee
User has at least one task assigned to them
User currently has both in-app and email notifications enabled
User has access to notification settings page

steps.action: Navigate to user profile settings and click on 'Notification Settings' or 'Preferences'
steps.expectedResult: Notification settings page is displayed showing all available notification channels (in-app and email) with current preferences

steps.action: Locate the email notification toggle/checkbox for task status updates and disable it
steps.expectedResult: Email notification option is unchecked/toggled off while in-app notification remains enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming 'Notification preferences saved successfully' and settings page reflects the updated preference

steps.action: Navigate to a task assigned to the user and update its status to trigger a notification
steps.expectedResult: Task status is updated successfully in the system

steps.action: Check the in-app notification panel for the status update notification
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed with correct task details, new status, and timestamp

steps.action: Check the email inbox for any notification related to the status update
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received, confirming that email notifications are disabled

steps.action: Verify notification delivery logs in the system
steps.expectedResult: Logs show notification sent only via in-app channel, email channel skipped based on user preference

postconditions: User notification preferences remain saved as in-app only
Future task status updates will only trigger in-app notifications
Email notification channel remains disabled until user re-enables it

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users do not receive notifications
preconditions: Two user accounts exist: User A (authorized) and User B (unauthorized)
User A is logged in and has a task assigned to them
User B is logged in in a separate browser/session and is NOT assigned to User A's task
Both users have notifications enabled
Admin/tester has access to audit logs and notification service logs

steps.action: As User A, navigate to the task details page for a task assigned only to User A
steps.expectedResult: Task details page loads successfully showing User A as the assignee

steps.action: Update the task status from current status to a different status (e.g., from 'Pending' to 'In Progress')
steps.expectedResult: Status update is processed successfully and task status changes in the system

steps.action: As User A, check the in-app notifications panel
steps.expectedResult: User A receives notification about the task status update with correct details

steps.action: Switch to User B's session and check the in-app notifications panel
steps.expectedResult: User B does not see any notification related to User A's task status update

steps.action: Check User B's email inbox for any notifications about User A's task
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received by User B regarding the task status update

steps.action: Access the notification service audit logs and filter by the task status update event
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs show notifications were sent only to User A (authorized user) and no notification records exist for User B

steps.action: Verify the notification recipient list in the logs matches only authorized users
steps.expectedResult: Logs confirm that the system correctly identified only User A as an affected employee and excluded User B from notification distribution

postconditions: Only authorized users have received notifications
Audit logs accurately reflect notification distribution to authorized users only
System security controls prevented unauthorized notification delivery

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to perform filtering tasks by status to achieve focused task management

testCases.title: Validate filtering tasks by single status
preconditions: User is logged into the system as an employee
User has multiple tasks assigned with different statuses (e.g., In Progress, Pending, Completed)
Task list page is accessible and functional
At least 3 tasks exist with 'In Progress' status and 3 tasks with other statuses

steps.action: Navigate to the task list page from the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Full task list page is displayed showing all tasks assigned to the user across all statuses with task count visible

steps.action: Locate the status filter dropdown or filter panel on the task list page
steps.expectedResult: Status filter UI component is visible showing all available status options (e.g., In Progress, Pending, Completed, etc.)

steps.action: Select a single status filter option 'In Progress' from the filter dropdown/panel
steps.expectedResult: Task list updates dynamically to display only tasks with 'In Progress' status, and task count reflects the filtered number

steps.action: Verify that all displayed tasks show 'In Progress' as their status
steps.expectedResult: All visible tasks in the list have 'In Progress' status and no tasks with other statuses are displayed

steps.action: Note the number of tasks displayed and verify it matches the expected count of 'In Progress' tasks
steps.expectedResult: Task count matches the number of tasks with 'In Progress' status

steps.action: Click the 'Clear filter' button or deselect the 'In Progress' status filter
steps.expectedResult: Full task list is restored showing all tasks across all statuses, and task count returns to the original total

steps.action: Verify that tasks with all statuses are now visible again
steps.expectedResult: Task list displays tasks with various statuses including In Progress, Pending, Completed, etc.

postconditions: Task list displays all tasks without any filters applied
Filter controls are reset to default state
No filter selections are active

testCases.title: Validate filtering tasks by multiple statuses
preconditions: User is logged into the system as an employee
User has tasks assigned with multiple different statuses
At least 2 tasks exist with 'In Progress' status, 2 with 'Pending' status, and 2 with 'Completed' status
Task list page supports multi-select filtering
Browser session persistence is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the task list page
steps.expectedResult: Full task list is displayed showing all tasks with various statuses

steps.action: Open the status filter control and select multiple status options: 'In Progress' and 'Pending'
steps.expectedResult: Both 'In Progress' and 'Pending' status filters are selected/checked in the filter UI

steps.action: Apply the multi-select filter or wait for automatic filtering
steps.expectedResult: Task list updates to show only tasks with either 'In Progress' OR 'Pending' status, excluding tasks with 'Completed' or other statuses

steps.action: Verify that all displayed tasks have either 'In Progress' or 'Pending' status
steps.expectedResult: All visible tasks match one of the selected statuses and no tasks with unselected statuses are shown

steps.action: Modify the filter selection by deselecting 'Pending' and adding 'Completed' to the selection
steps.expectedResult: Filter selection updates to show 'In Progress' and 'Completed' as selected statuses

steps.action: Observe the task list update
steps.expectedResult: Task list updates dynamically to show only tasks with 'In Progress' or 'Completed' status, excluding 'Pending' tasks

steps.action: Note the current filter selections ('In Progress' and 'Completed')
steps.expectedResult: Filter UI clearly indicates that 'In Progress' and 'Completed' are the active filters

steps.action: Reload the page by pressing F5 or clicking the browser refresh button
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads successfully and task list page is displayed

steps.action: Check the status filter selections after page reload
steps.expectedResult: Previously selected filters ('In Progress' and 'Completed') are persisted and still active, showing the same filtered task list

steps.action: Verify the task list content matches the persisted filter selections
steps.expectedResult: Task list displays only tasks with 'In Progress' or 'Completed' status, confirming filter persistence across page reload

postconditions: Filter selections remain persisted in the user session
Task list continues to show filtered results based on saved preferences
User can continue working with the same filter context

testCases.title: Ensure filtered task list loads within performance SLA
preconditions: User is logged into the system as an employee
Test environment has 1000+ tasks loaded in the database assigned to the user
Tasks have various statuses distributed across the dataset
Network conditions are normal (not throttled)
Performance monitoring tools are available to measure load times
User has appropriate authorization to view all assigned tasks

steps.action: Navigate to the task list page and wait for the full unfiltered list to load
steps.expectedResult: Task list page loads showing all 1000+ tasks with pagination or infinite scroll, and total task count is displayed

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor API calls
steps.expectedResult: Network monitoring is active and ready to capture API request/response times

steps.action: Select one or more status filters (e.g., 'In Progress') and start a timer or note the timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Filter selection is applied and API request is initiated to fetch filtered results

steps.action: Monitor the time taken for the filtered task list to fully load and display results
steps.expectedResult: Filtered task list loads and displays within 2 seconds, meeting the performance SLA requirement

steps.action: Verify the API response time in the Network tab for the GET /api/tasks?status=... request
steps.expectedResult: API response time is under 2 seconds and HTTP status code is 200 OK

steps.action: Clear the filter to return to the full unfiltered task list view
steps.expectedResult: Full task list loads successfully without errors or performance degradation

steps.action: Apply a different status filter and measure the load time again
steps.expectedResult: Filtered results load within 2 seconds consistently

steps.action: Navigate between filtered and unfiltered views multiple times (at least 3 iterations)
steps.expectedResult: UI remains responsive throughout all navigation actions with no lag, freezing, or JavaScript errors

steps.action: Check browser console for any errors or warnings during filter operations
steps.expectedResult: No errors or warnings are displayed in the browser console

steps.action: Verify that only tasks authorized for the current user are displayed in both filtered and unfiltered views
steps.expectedResult: All displayed tasks are assigned to or accessible by the current user, and no unauthorized tasks are visible in the list

steps.action: Randomly select several tasks from the filtered list and verify their status matches the applied filter
steps.expectedResult: All sampled tasks have the correct status matching the filter criteria, confirming data accuracy

postconditions: Task list performance meets the 2-second SLA requirement

UI remains stable and responsive under load

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to perform validating task status updates to achieve data integrity

testCases.title: Validate acceptance of valid status update
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has permission to update task status
At least one task exists in the system with current status 'In Progress'
Business rules engine is configured with valid status transition flows
API endpoint PUT /api/tasks/{taskId}/status is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page and select a task with status 'In Progress'
steps.expectedResult: Task details are displayed with current status showing 'In Progress'

steps.action: Click on the status dropdown and select a valid next status (e.g., 'Completed')
steps.expectedResult: Status dropdown displays available valid status options

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory fields required for the status update (e.g., completion notes, actual hours)
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields are populated with valid data

steps.action: Click the 'Update Status' button to submit the status change
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and update is accepted and saved to the database

steps.action: Verify confirmation message is displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Success confirmation message appears stating 'Task status updated successfully' or similar

steps.action: Refresh the task details page and verify the status has been updated
steps.expectedResult: Task now displays the new status 'Completed' with timestamp of update

steps.action: Navigate to the audit logs section and search for the task update record
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is found showing task ID, old status, new status, timestamp, and employee who made the change

steps.action: Verify all details in the audit log are correct and complete
steps.expectedResult: Update is logged correctly with 100% accuracy of all fields

postconditions: Task status is updated to 'Completed' in the database
Audit log contains complete record of the status change
Employee can view the updated task status
System remains in stable state ready for next operation

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid status update
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has permission to update task status
At least one task exists with current status 'Completed'
Business rules define that 'Completed' tasks cannot transition to 'In Progress'
Validation rules are properly configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page and select a task with status 'Completed'
steps.expectedResult: Task details are displayed showing current status as 'Completed'

steps.action: Attempt to change the status to an invalid transition state (e.g., 'In Progress')
steps.expectedResult: Status dropdown allows selection but validation will occur on submission

steps.action: Fill in any required fields and click 'Update Status' button to submit the invalid status update
steps.expectedResult: System validates the status transition and rejects the update

steps.action: Verify that an error message is displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Descriptive error message appears stating 'Invalid status transition: Cannot change from Completed to In Progress' or similar clear explanation

steps.action: Verify that the task status remains unchanged in the system
steps.expectedResult: Task status remains 'Completed' and no update is saved to the database

steps.action: Review the error message details to understand the validation failure reason
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly explains why the transition is invalid and what valid options are available

steps.action: Correct the status by selecting a valid transition (e.g., 'Archived' if allowed from 'Completed')
steps.expectedResult: Valid status option is selected

steps.action: Resubmit the status update with the corrected valid status
steps.expectedResult: System validates and accepts the update, displaying success confirmation

steps.action: Verify the task now shows the new valid status
steps.expectedResult: Task status is successfully updated to the valid status with confirmation message displayed

postconditions: Invalid status update was rejected and not saved
Task eventually updated to valid status after correction
Validation error was logged in system logs
Employee understands the valid status transition rules

testCases.title: Ensure validation completes within performance SLA

Multiple tasks (at least 10) exist in the system with various statuses
System is under normal operational load
Performance monitoring tools are configured and accessible

steps.action: Open performance monitoring dashboard or prepare timing measurement tool

steps.expectedResult: Task update form is displayed

steps.action: Submit the status update and measure the validation processing time from submission to response

steps.expectedResult: Each validation completes within 1 second for all submissions

steps.action: Cross-reference the number of validation errors triggered with the number of log entries

steps.action: Monitor system resource utilization (CPU, memory, response times) during the validation tests
steps.expectedResult: System resources remain within normal operating parameters

steps.action: Verify system responsiveness by navigating to different pages and performing other operations
steps.expectedResult: No performance degradation occurs - system remains responsive with normal page load times

steps.action: Review overall performance metrics and confirm all validations met the 1-second SLA
steps.expectedResult: 100% of status update validations completed within the 1-second performance requirement

postconditions: All validation operations completed within 1 second SLA
All validation errors are logged in system logs with complete accuracy
